results.title: The Photo conductive effect
results.creator_credit: Frank A. Hoare, Katrina Rank, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and David Cons
results.brief_description: Shows how the photo-conductive cell is highly sensitive to infra-red radiation. Illustrates various methods of detecting and measuring such radiation; history of research into the photo-conductive effect - Willoughby Smith’s experiments and Adam’s and Day’s work; composition of a photo-conductive cell and its working; the distance in spectral response curve between the different substances; operation of guided missiles, steel furnaces, and medical analysis.

results.title: The Philippines: island republic
results.brief_description: The Philippines is a multi-island republic, with about half of its 7000 islands inhabited. Under the colonial rule of the United States, the democratic system of government was introduced, universal public education, and an all-weather road system. Reviews the agriculture, and economy of the islands and points out the relative prosperity.

results.title: The Phase contrast microscope [Silent]
results.creator_credit: B Troughton + Simms Ltd and G.G. Grand
results.brief_description: Explains the properties of light and image formation in a normal microscope, and the effect of the Zernike disc in transforming changes in wave phase into changes in amplitudes to phase-contrast microscope is shown in use, with some examples of images invisible by normal miscroscopy.

results.title: The Phantom. Vol. 3
results.creator_credit: Rudolph C. Flothow, Columbia and B Reeves Eason
results.brief_description: Episodes eleven to fifteen. Originally a comic-strip character written by Lee Falk and drawn by Ray Moore, This popular serial featured Tom Tyler as The Ghost Who Walks and Ace the Wonder Dog as Devil. Faithful to the original strip, in the first episode The Phantom is killed by the evil Dr. Bremmer and his equally evil henchmen. As the story continues, we see his son (Tyler) adopting his father’s costume and perpetuating the myth that The Phantom is back from the dead. Eventually scientists (evil) try to kill The Phantom for good so they can take the Lost City of Zoloz and replace The Phantom with an imposter to trick the natives into slavery. Will The Phantom survive? Will the natives succumb to evil? Cast includes: Kenneth R. MacDonald, Frank Shannon, Jeanne Bates, Guy Kingsford, Joe Devlin, Ernie Adams, John Bagni.

results.title: The Phantom. Vol. 1
results.creator_credit: Rudolph C. Flothow, Columbia and B Reeves Eason
results.brief_description: Volume one contains the first five episodes of the movie serial that first brought The Phantom to the large screen. Originally a comic-strip character written by Lee Falk and drawn by Ray Moore, This popular serial featured Tom Tyler as The Ghost Who Walks and Ace the Wonder Dog as Devil. Faithful to the original strip, in the first episode The Phantom is killed by the evil Dr. Bremmer and his equally evil henchmen. As the story continues, we see his son (Tyler) adopting his father’s costume and perpetuating the myth that The Phantom is back from the dead. Eventually scientists (evil) try to kill The Phantom for good so they can take the Lost City of Zoloz and replace The Phantom with an imposter to trick the natives into slavery. Will The Phantom survive? Will the natives succumb to evil? Cast includes: Kenneth R. MacDonald, Frank Shannon, Jeanne Bates, Guy Kingsford, Joe Devlin, Ernie Adams, John Bagni.

results.title: The Phantom Treehouse (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A delightful animated, adventure story which is a fantasy tale about two children, Lucy and Tom who discover a mysterious treehouse and fall into a strange, colourful land.

results.title: The Peter principle (TEFC)
results.brief_description: In any hierarchical organization, en employee tend to se to his level of incompetence and remains there. Dr Laurence J. Peters outlines the dangers of working in a hierarchy and offers advice to employers and employees on the best use of the Peter Principle. The serious social implications from both an individual and organisational viewpoint includes stress related illness, unbalanced home life, inefficiency and incompetence.

results.title: The Personal problem
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plant Supervisors Problems”.
Shows that a supervisor who avoids discussing an employee’s personal problem with him may cause a production fall-off by the worker.
